description: Law is revealed as a Shichibukai who has allied with Caesar Clown on Punk Hazard. When the Straw Hats and the children escape the facility, they encounter both Law and Vice Admiral Smoker. Law prevents the Marines' escape by lifting their warship, setting the stage for a confrontation.

events.title: Nami and Chopper Discover Frozen Prisoners
events.description: While leading the rescued children through Punk Hazard's facility, Nami and Chopper stumble upon a horrifying room filled with frozen people dressed in prison garments, revealing the dark nature of the island's past experiments.
events.significance: This discovery hints at the cruel experiments and dark history of Punk Hazard, showing that Caesar Clown's evil extends beyond just the children.

quotes.text: What is this place? These people... they're frozen!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami reacts with horror to discovering the frozen prisoners

events.title: Franky Demonstrates Franky Tank
events.description: Franky showcases his new post-timeskip ability by deploying tank treads from his legs, allowing him to move like a miniature tank. The children are fascinated and delighted by this display.
events.significance: Demonstrates Franky's upgraded capabilities after his two-year training period and his modifications in the Nightmare of Baldimore.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky shows off his tank tread ability to the children

events.title: Centaurs Attack Luffy's Group
events.description: Brownbeard's centaur patrol unit attacks Luffy, Zoro, Usopp, and Robin, attempting to prevent them from interfering with Caesar's operations on the island.
events.significance: Shows the opposition the Straw Hats face from Caesar's forces and establishes the centaurs as minor antagonists.

events.title: Law Revealed as Shichibukai
events.description: Trafalgar Law emerges from the facility, revealing himself to be the mysterious figure working with Caesar Clown. Smoker and the Marines discover that Law has become one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea during the two-year timeskip.
events.significance: Major revelation that Law's status has changed dramatically since Marineford. His position as a Shichibukai gives him legal protection and explains his presence on the forbidden island.

quotes.text: Trafalgar Law... So you're the one who's been on this island.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker confronts Law upon discovering him at Punk Hazard

events.title: Law's 100 Hearts Revealed
events.description: The Marines reveal that Trafalgar Law obtained his Shichibukai position by delivering 100 pirate hearts to the World Government, demonstrating his ruthlessness and surgical abilities.
events.significance: Establishes Law's reputation post-timeskip and shows the lengths he went to in order to secure his Warlord position, which is part of his larger plan for revenge against Doflamingo.

quotes.text: He sent one hundred pirate hearts to the World Government to get his position as a Warlord of the Sea.
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Tashigi explains how Law became a Shichibukai

events.title: Law Claims Punk Hazard as Vacation Home
events.description: Law attempts to deceive Smoker by claiming Punk Hazard is his personal vacation home and that no one else is on the island, despite clear evidence to the contrary.
events.significance: Shows Law's cunning and willingness to lie to Marines, even though his deception is transparent given the circumstances.

quotes.text: This is my vacation home. There's no one here but me.
quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law's obvious lie to Smoker about being alone on Punk Hazard

events.title: Distress Signal Transmission Played
events.description: Smoker and Tashigi play a recording of the distress call that brought them to Punk Hazard, featuring someone asking for help because of a samurai attack. Law claims the Marines forged the transmission to trap pirates.
events.significance: Reveals how Smoker was drawn to Punk Hazard and shows Law's continued attempts to deflect suspicion, even though the transmission was genuine.

quotes.text: Marines often tend to forge messages and transmissions to catch pirates.
quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law's attempt to dismiss the genuine distress signal

events.title: Straw Hats and Children Emerge
events.description: Sanji, Nami, Franky, Chopper, and the rescued children burst out of the laboratory's entrance, only to find themselves face-to-face with both Trafalgar Law and the Marine forces led by Smoker.
events.significance: Creates a tense three-way standoff between the Straw Hats, Law, and the Marines. The Straw Hats don't yet know whether Law is friend or foe.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji recognizes Smoker and Tashigi and warns the others to flee

events.title: Law Uses Tact to Lift Marine Warship
events.description: Law demonstrates the enhanced power of his Ope Ope no Mi by creating a massive Room and using Tact to telekinetically lift the entire G-5 Marine warship along with the surrounding water into the air, preventing the Marines from escaping.
events.significance: Showcases Law's significantly increased power post-timeskip. His ability to lift an entire warship demonstrates the scale of his Room has grown tremendously.

quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law uses his Devil Fruit power to lift the Marine ship

quotes.text: I won't allow the Marines to escape.
quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law declares his intention to prevent the Marines from leaving

events.title: Law vs Smoker Confrontation Begins
events.description: Law and Smoker prepare to fight, with Smoker acknowledging that his men cannot handle Law due to his Devil Fruit abilities. This sets up a major battle between a Shichibukai and a Vice Admiral.
events.significance: Establishes the coming battle between two powerful Devil Fruit users and shows Smoker's recognition of Law's dangerous abilities.

quotes.text: My men can't handle you because of your Devil Fruit. I'll fight you myself.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker readies himself to battle Law

quotes.text: He sent one hundred pirate hearts to the World Government to get his position as a Warlord of the Sea.
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Revealing how Law became a Shichibukai

quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law uses his enhanced Devil Fruit power

quotes.text: I won't allow the Marines to escape.
quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law prevents the Marines from leaving Punk Hazard

quotes.text: My men can't handle you because of your Devil Fruit. I'll fight you myself.
quotes.speaker: Smoker

themes.description: Law's presence on Punk Hazard and his alliance with Caesar Clown raises questions about his true motives, especially given his new status as a Shichibukai.
themes.symbolism: Law's lies to Smoker about the island being empty represent the layers of deception surrounding the Punk Hazard operation.

themes.description: The episode explores different forms of power and authority through Law's Shichibukai status, Smoker's Marine rank, and the Straw Hats' pirate freedom.
themes.symbolism: The lifted warship symbolizes Law's power to upset the established order and Marine authority.

themes.description: The frozen prisoners and the children's kidnapping reveal the dark legacy of Punk Hazard's experiments and Caesar's ongoing cruelty.
themes.symbolism: The frozen bodies represent the forgotten victims of governmental and scientific overreach.

characterSpotlights.development: Law is revealed as a Shichibukai with unclear motives, working with Caesar Clown but showing his immense power and strategic thinking by confronting the Marines.

Confronts Smoker and the G-5 Marines

characterSpotlights.development: Nami continues to lead and protect the rescued children while discovering more horrifying evidence of Punk Hazard's dark experiments.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended certain scenes for pacing, including the discovery of the frozen prisoners and the centaur attacks.
Franky's tank demonstration is given more screen time in the anime to showcase the ability.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts only pages 3-19 of Chapter 660, showing the anime's slower pacing during the Punk Hazard arc.
Law's Tact ability, showcased prominently in this episode, becomes one of his signature techniques throughout the series.

trivia.fact: Episode 585 received a 9.0% TV rating in Japan and ranked 6th for the week, showing strong viewership.
This marks one of the first major post-timeskip confrontations between the Straw Hats and established Marine forces.
